$_REQUEST combines POST, GET, and cookie values in one array, making it easy for an attacker to modify a POST or cookie value by instead putting it in a GET and sending the URL to the victim
If a string is missing a null terminator, strlen will read past the end of the buffer

These functions are historically error-prone and have been associated with a significant number of vulnerabilities. Most of these functions have safer alternatives, such as replacing 'strcpy' with 'strlcpy' or 'strcpy_s'.
